main_definition: Parents are the mother or father of a child.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Mother: The female parent who gives birth to and cares for her children.
meanings_and_examples.example: My mom is always there for me when I need support.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Father: The male parent who has fathered a child with the mother, typically providing care and guidance.
meanings_and_examples.example: His dad taught him how to ride a bike before he started school.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Biological parents: The genetic individuals (mother and father) who are responsible for giving birth or raising their child, regardless of the current living situation.
meanings_and_examples.example: The biological parents decided to give up their baby for adoption.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Legal parents: Individuals recognized by law as a child's mother and father. These can include those who are biologically related or have legally adopted the child.
meanings_and_examples.example: The legal parents signed up to volunteer at my school event.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adoptive Parents: Individuals who, through the adoption process, become a child's mother and father even though they are not biologically related.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their adoptive parents gave them love just like any other parent.
